official_title: A bill to amend title 17 of the United States Code with respect to public performances of nondramatic musical works by means of coin-operated phonorecord players, and for other purposes.
short_title: Coin-Operated Phonorecord Player Copyright Act of 1983

summary.text: Coin-Operated Phonorecord Player Copyright Act of 1983 - Revises limitations on the performance of a nondramatic musical work on a coin-operated phonorecord player (jukebox) to require: (1) the manufacturer or importer of the player, rather than the operator, to register and pay a one-time only compulsory licensing fee of $50, rather than an adjusted annual fee, to the Copyright Royalty Tribunal for distribution to the copyright holders; and (2) the operator of a currently owned player to pay a compulsory licensing fee of up to $25 based upon the number of years of useful life remaining in the player. Directs the Register of Copyright to keep a list of all registered players. Restates the royalty distribution procedures.

titles.title: Coin-Operated Phonorecord Player Copyright Act of 1983
A bill to amend title 17 of the United States Code with respect to public performances of nondramatic musical works by means of coin-operated phonorecord players, and for other purposes.
